title: Quality Assurance Officer Job at D-Degree Digital Hub Limited
content:
D-Degree Digital is a Google Partner in Africa (Ghana and Nigeria). The company’s reputation has speedily grown to become a must-stop point for most major digital and media projects in Africa. It provides soft-landing leverage for developmental digital and media exercises across the shores of the sub-Sahara region. Aside, we are a Digital Project Facilitation, Digital Marketing, and Fintech Solution Company with years of experience and uncommon achievements.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Quality Assurance Officer
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Location: Ogba, Ikeja, Lagos, Hybrid (Onsite at D-Degree HQ, Ogba, Lagos & Remote)
Employment Type: Full-time
Department: Technology / Product Development
Reports To: Product Lead / CTO

Job Summary


	D-Degree Digital Hub is seeking a detail-oriented and proactive Quality Assurance Specialist (QAS) to join our team in ensuring the reliability, usability, and excellence of the DDSA (Direct Digital Sales Agent) application.
	The QAS will be responsible for testing, identifying bugs, verifying fixes, and validating performance across the DDSA mobile and web platforms.
	The ideal candidate must have a passion for quality, a critical eye for detail, and the discipline to enforce product standards as DDSA scales across Nigeria and beyond.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and execute manual and automated test cases for the DDSA app
	Conduct functional, usability, UI/UX, performance, regression, and security testing
	Identify, document, and track bugs using issue management tools (e.g., Jira, Trello, ClickUp)
	Collaborate with developers, designers, and product managers to validate fixes and improvements
	Ensure cross-device and cross-platform compatibility (Android, iOS, Web)
	Simulate user scenarios (agent onboarding, transaction flow, recovery path, etc.)
	Provide QA reports, test coverage metrics, and product health feedback
	Participate in release planning, sprint reviews, and post-launch assessments
	Recommend enhancements and provide input on app stability and user experience


Requirements


	Proven experience as a QA Tester or QAS, preferably on digital platforms or fintech apps
	Familiarity with mobile testing tools, platforms, and bug tracking systems
	Strong understanding of Agile/Scrum environments and QA methodologies
	Excellent attention to detail and analytical thinking
	Ability to communicate clearly with technical and non-technical teams
	Bonus: Experience testing agent or onboarding systems, digital wallets, or financial platforms


Preferred Qualifications:


	B.Sc. in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related field
	Certification in Quality Assurance (e.g., ISTQB, CSTE) is a plus
	Familiarity with HTML, APIs, or basic scripting a plus (but not required).


Why Join Us?


	Be part of Nigeria’s first all-sector Digital Financial Inclusion platform
	Contribute to a product with national impact and millions of end users
	Grow with an innovation-driven team at the heart of digital transformation


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Application and CV to: info@d-degreedigital.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

title: Software Engineer (Frontend) Job at Interswitch
content:
Interswitch is an Africa-focused integrated digital payments and commerce company that facilitates the electronic circulation of money as well as the exchange of value between individuals and organisations on a timely and consistent basis. We started operations in 2002 as a transaction switching and electronic payments processing company, and have progressively evolved into an integrated payment services company, building and managing payment infrastructure as well as delivering innovative payment products and transactional services throughout the African continent. At Interswitch, we offer unique career opportunities for individuals capable of playing key roles and adding value in an innovative and fun environment.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Position: Software Engineer (Frontend)

Job Location: Lagos

Job Purpose


	Our Innovation Hub is seeking an experienced Senior Front End Software Engineer who will play a crucial role in driving our team's technical capabilities to deliver innovative products.
	The ideal candidate will be passionate about front-end development and user experience, have experience working with a range of technologies, and have a proven track record of delivering high-quality web applications


Responsibilities


	Develop and maintain responsive web applications and user interfaces that are visually appealing and intuitive to use.
	Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and prioritize features, requirements, and technical solutions that will drive innovation.
	Lead the design and implementation of scalable and maintainable software architecture that meets functional and non-functional requirements.
	Drive the adoption of modern front-end technologies and best practices within the team, including performance optimization, accessibility, and security.
	Mentor and coach other team members to improve their technical skills and contribute to the overall success of the team.
	Participate in code reviews, debugging, and troubleshooting to ensure that software is reliable, maintainable, and performs optimally.
	Stay up-to-date with the latest trends, technologies, and best practices in front-end development.


Requirements


	Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science or a related field.
	3+ years of experience in front-end software engineering.
	Expertise in React Native
	Experience with responsive design and mobile-first development.
	Understanding of software development methodologies, including agile and DevOps.
	Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
	Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

title: General Manager Job at Uncle Stan's Foods
content:
Uncle Stan's Foods is a small chops company known for it's unique finger food taste all over Lagos. Our brand makes us unique.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: General Manager

Job Location: Lagos

Job Description
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are looking for a self-motivated and results-driven General Manager to direct and manage our organization's business activities and to develop and implement effective business strategies and programs.
	Duties for the general manager will include allocating budget resources, formulating policies, coordinating business operations, monitoring and motivating staff, managing operational costs, ensuring good customer service, improving administration processes, engaging with vendors, hiring and training employees, identifying business opportunities, and monitoring financial activities.
	Your entrepreneurial spirit and vision in directing business functions will assist our organization in maintaining relationships with clients, generating new business, increasing staff productivity, improving service, ensuring sustainability, and meeting business objectives.
	The successful candidate for this role should possess excellent communication skills, superior knowledge of business functions, exceptional budgeting, and finance skills, and strong leadership qualities.
	The noteworthy general manager should account for all business activities, support staff development, enhance efficiency, drive sales and improve revenue, maintain relationships with clients, enhance the organization's image, and meet overall growth objectives.


Responsibilities


	Overseeing daily business operations.
	Developing and implementing growth strategies.
	Training low-level managers and staff.
	Creating and managing budgets.
	Improving revenue.
	Hiring employees.
	Evaluating performance and productivity.
	Analyzing accounting and financial data.
	Researching and identifying growth opportunities.
	Generating reports and giving presentations.


Requirements


	Candidates should posess a Degree in Business Management or a Master's Degree in Business Administration.
	Good knowledge of different business functions.
	Strong leadership qualities.
	Excellent communication skills.
	Highly organized.
	Strong work ethic.
	Good interpersonal skills.
	Meticulous attention to detail.
	Computer literate.
	Proactive nature.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hrunclestansfoods@gmail.com using the Job Positon as the subject of the email.

title: Inventory and Sales Officer Job at MN Global Ventures
content:
MN Global Ventures - We are a reputable company that imports and supplies high-quality medical equipment to top hospitals and healthcare centers across Nigeria. We are committed to improving lives through reliable medical solutions and efficient service delivery.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Inventory and Sales Officer
Job Location: Ago Palace Way - Okota, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: Medical Equipment Supply
Work Schedule: Monday to Friday, 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM
Branch Visits: Twice a month to Idumota branch (logistics covered by company)

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking an organized and proactiveInventory and Sales Support Officerto manage inventory records, promote products online, support customer engagement, and handle basic sales documentation.
	This role requires someone who is reliable, detail-oriented, and able to work independently while supporting the team’s operations.


Key Responsibilities


	Track and maintain accurate records of warehouse inventory.
	Upload and promote company products on social media platforms.
	Log all sales and stock movements on the system promptly.
	Attend to walk-in customers and provide excellent service.
	Draft invoices and support preparation of contracts or client documentation.
	Collaborate with warehouse and sales teams for smooth order fulfillment.
	Visit the company’s Idumota branch twice monthly (logistics covered).


Requirements


	Female candidates only (ages 22–35 preferred).
	1+ year of experience in inventory, customer service, or admin roles is an advantage.
	OND, HND, or Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or related field.
	Proficient in Microsoft Word and basic inventory management software.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
	Ability to multitask, stay organized, and work with minimal supervision.
	Familiar with using social media for business promotion.
	Must be honest, hardworking, and committed to maintaining confidentiality at all times.


What We Offer


	Salary: N100,000 - N120,000 monthly.
	A supportive and team-driven environment
	Real-world experience in the healthcare and medical equipment space
	Company-covered logistics for scheduled branch visits


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a brief cover letter to: princessojiaku37@gmail.com using "Inventory and Sales Support Officer Application" as the subject of the email.

Proximity Notice


	Applicants must reside in or around Ago Palace Way, Isolo, Amuwo-Odofin, Festac, and its environs.
	Proximity is important and will be a key factor in the selection process.

title: Data Entry Officer Job at D-Degree Digital Hub Limited
content:
D-Degree Digital Hub is a leading Nigerian innovation and technology company dedicated to digital inclusion, fintech enablement, digital product development, and capacity building. Founded with the vision to empower communities and bridge the digital divide, D-Degree operates at the intersection of technology, finance, education, and entrepreneurship.
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



We are the creators of DDSA (Direct Digital Sales Agent) — Nigeria’s first all-sector Digital Financial Inclusion platform — designed to power job creation, agent network systems (ANS), and seamless multi-sector digital access across rural and urban communities. Through strategic partnerships with national institutions and grassroots stakeholders, D-Degree Digital Hub is helping to activate millions of empowered digital agents, transform how services reach the underserved, and foster a truly inclusive digital economy.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Data Entry Officer
Job Location: Ogba / Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-Time / Contract
Department: Operations / Admin
Reports To: Operations Manager

Job Summary


	We are seeking a highly accurate and reliable Data Entry Officer to support the day-to-day backend operations of the DDSA (Direct Digital Sales Agent) platform.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for entering, updating, and managing large volumes of data related to agents, transactions, field activities, and onboarding documentation, ensuring accuracy, confidentiality, and quick turnaround.


Key Responsibilities


	Accurately enter and update agent registration data into the DDSA system
	Review and validate agent profiles, forms, and supporting documents
	Track data inconsistencies and work with field teams for correction/resolution
	Maintain proper digital filing systems and backups
	Generate daily or weekly data reports for internal reviews
	Flag errors, duplicates, and suspicious entries to supervisors
	Assist in cleaning, organizing, and migrating historical data into the DDSA database
	Maintain confidentiality and secure handling of sensitive agent and user records.


Preferred Qualifications


	OND / HND / B.Sc. in Business Admin, Computer Science, or related discipline
	Prior experience in data entry, admin support, or digital onboarding roles
	Bonus: Experience in financial inclusion, agent registration, or fintech fieldwork.


Requirements:


	Strong attention to detail and accuracy
	Fast and error-free typing skills (minimum 40 WPM preferred)
	Experience with Excel, Google Sheets, and online form tools
	Familiarity with CRM tools, dashboards, or entry platforms is an added advantage
	Ability to work with minimal supervision and meet deadlines
	Excellent organization and time management skills
	Strong written and verbal communication skills.


Why Join Us?


	Salary: N50,000 Monthly.
	Be part of a national movement powering digital jobs and financial access
	Join a growing team committed to innovation, impact, and inclusion
	Gain valuable experience working within a tech-enabled ecosystem


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Application and CV to: info@d-degreedigital.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
